b.i: How old is your plant ?
Is there yellow part around the spot ?
. Does the spots on leaf look like this ?

Spray streptomycin sulfate 9% + tetracycline hydrochloride 1% SP solution (streptocycline) 40-100 ppm in fields after the appearance of first true leaves. Two sprays, one before transplanting (seed beds) and another after transplanting (main field).
Raising nursery in protected condition (with net of sufficient mesh size to prevent the entry of vector, whitefly)
Seeds from disease free healthy plants should be selected for sowing.
In the nursery all the infected plants should be removed carefully and destroyed. Seedlings infected with the viral disease should not be used for transplanting.
Before transplanting dip the roots of seedlings for 15 minutes in 12 17.8 % SL @ 60-70 ml in 200 l of water/acre for management of leaf curl vector.
Field sanitation, roguing of affected plants
Raise barrier crops-cereals (maize or sorghum) around the field.
Peppermint can be used as repellant plant for whitefly.
Yellow sticky traps \n cards @ 10/acre may reduce the whiteflies population
Conserve parasitoids such as Encarsia sp. (nymphal and pupal), Eretmocerus spp (nymphal and pupal). etc.
Conserve predators such as Dicyphus hesperus, (mirid bug), dragonfly, spider, robber fly, praying mantis, fire ants, coccinellids, lace wings, big eyed bugs (Geocoris sp) etc.
Spray neem seed kernel extract (NSKE) 5% \n azadirachtin 5% W/W neem extract concentrate @ 80 g in 160 l of water/acre

Spray dimethoate 30% EC @ 396 ml in 200-400 l of water/acre 
 imidacloprid 17.8 SL @ 60-70 ml in 200 l of water/acre 
 thiamethoxam 25 WG @ 80 g in 200 l of water/acre 
 carbofuran 3% CG @ 16,000 g/acre 
 malathion 50% EC @ 600 ml in 200-400 l of water/acre 
 oxydemeton-methyl 25% EC @ 400 ml in 200-400 l of water/acre 
 phorate 10% CG @ 6,000 g/acre 
 spiromesifen 22.9% SC @ 250 ml in 200 l of water/acre
Staking of plants to avoid touching fruits on ground.
Same as in seed and seedling and vegetative stages.
Use resistant or tolerant cultivars
Change the nursery beds location every season,h eradicate weeds and volunteer tomato plants, fertilize properly
Avoid planting overlapping crops in adjacent area.

Spray azoxystrobin 23% SC @ 200 ml in 200 l of water/acre 
 captan 50% WP @ 1000 g in 300-400 l of water/acre 
 captan 75% WP @ 666.8 g in 400 l of water/acre 
 copper oxy chloride 50% WP @ 1000 g in 300-400 l of water/acre 
 copper sulphate 2.62% SC @ 400 ml in 200 l of water/acre 
 iprodione 50% WP @ 600 g in 200 l of water/acre 
 kitazin 48% EC @ 80 ml in 80 l of water/acre 
 mancozeb 35% SC @ 200 g in 200 l water/acre 
 mancozeb 75% WG @ 400 g in 200 l of water/acre 
 pyraclostrobin 20% WG @ 150-200 g in 200 l of water/acre 
 zineb 75% WP @ 600-800 g in 300-400 l of water/acre 
 ziram 80% WP @ 600-800 g in 300-400 l of water/acre 
 famoxadone 16.6% + cymoxanil 22.1% SC @ 200 g in 200 l of water/acre 
 metiram 55% + pyraclostrobin 5% WG @ 600-700 g in 200 l of water/acre
Field sanitation.
Destruction of alternate hosts.
Provide light irrigation.

Spray mancozeb 35% SC @ 200 g in 200 l water/acre 
 mancozen 75% WP @ 600-800 g in 300 l of water/acre 
 zineb 75% WP @ 600-800 g in 300-400 l of water/acre 
 famoxadone 16.6% + cymoxanil 22.1% SC @ 200 g in 200 l of water/acre 
 cymoxanil 8% + mancozeb 64% WP @ 600 g in 200-300 l of water/acre 
 azoxystrobin 23% SC @ 200 ml in 200 l of water/acre 
 captan 50% WP @ 1000 g in 300-400 l of water/acre 
 captan 75% WP @ 666.8 g in 400 l of water/acre 
 copper oxy chloride 50% WP @ 1000 g in 300-400 l of water/acre 
 copper sulphate 2.62% SC @ 400 ml in 200 l of water/acre 
 cyazaphamid 34.5% SC @ 80 ml in 200 l of water/acre 
 metrium 75% WG @ 1000 g in 200-300 l of water/acre
Seeds from disease free healthy plants should be selected for sowing.
The seeds should be thoroughly rinsed and dried in shade.
In the nursery all the infected plants should be removed carefully and destroyed. Seedlings infected with the viral disease should not be used for transplanting.
Crop rotation with crops other than tobacco, potato, chilli, capsicum, brinjal, and other solanaceous crops should be undertaken
